text:
Is there a way to transpose an array of Any? I have a `12×500 Array{Any,2}` I want it to be 500x12. If I do transpose it throws an error.
```500×12 LinearAlgebra.Transpose{Any,Array{Any,2}}:
Error showing value of type LinearAlgebra.Transpose{Any,Array{Any,2}}:
ERROR: MethodError: no method matching transpose(::String)
Closest candidates are:
  transpose(::Missing) at missing.jl:100
  transpose(::Number) at number.jl:168
  transpose(::LinearAlgebra.Transpose) at D:\buildbot\worker\package_win64\build\usr\share\julia\stdlib\v1.5\LinearAlgebra\src\adjtrans.jl:165```

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/56607| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!
If your array doesn't just contain numbers, you want `permeutedims`, or `PermutedDimsArray` as its lazy counterpart.

elements.text: If your array doesn't just contain numbers, you want
permeutedims
, or
PermutedDimsArray
as its lazy counterpart.

text: this is a scary discovery. If I suppress the output (using semicolon) it works and gets assigned to `ans` in repl. But `ans` is completely unusable variable as it throws errors whenever I index it, display it  or anything with it for that matter.
